title.narrative: Outcome 1:- Improved availability of and increased access to SRHR services, including family planning, to build resilience of communities in the intervention areas.

description.narrative: Percent of currently married women age 15-49 in the intervention areas that are using any modern contraceptive method. Note:- Following a monitoring field visit of May 2019, it was highlighted that there is a need for improved coordination efforts between implementing partners as well as investing in developing the capacity of the local authorities in order to improve the coordination, implementation, monitoring and planning. DK emphasised the necessity to be realistic in revised results, that the focus should be on delivering the agreed results with a view to use the project as a learning platform to sustain resilience. Amendments were made to the first results framework, budget and the work plans and one additional output was added in the revised result framework with the aim to empower the district level health offices and platforms to implement the demand sideof the project activities. As a result, there is a slight difference between the 1st and the revised results frame work.

title.narrative: Outcome 1:- Improved availability of and increased access to SRHR services, including family planning, to build resilience of communities in the intervention areas.

description.narrative: Percent of currently married women age 15-49 in the intervention areas that are using any modern contraceptive method. Note:- Following a monitoring field visit of May 2019, it was highlighted that there is a need for improved coordination efforts between implementing partners as well as investing in developing the capacity of the local authorities in order to improve the coordination, implementation, monitoring and planning. DK emphasised the necessity to be realistic in revised results, that the focus should be on delivering the agreed results with a view to use the project as a learning platform to sustain resilience. Amendments were made to the first results framework, budget and the work plans and one additional output was added in the revised result framework with the aim to empower the district level health offices and platforms to implement the demand sideof the project activities. As a result, there is a slight difference between the 1st and the revised results frame work.

title.narrative: Output 2:- SRHR/FP specific needs of vulnerable groups, including young people age 15-24 and women age 15-49 in IDP camps, humanitarian food distribution areas and PSNP areas (intervention areas) are addressed.

description.narrative:
Percentage of the group in the catchement area who have access to UNFPA supported SRHR/FP services and drugs Note from implementing partner/UNFPA:- Since the baseline survey is not yet finalized, it was not possible to report on the indicator “percentage of the group in the catchment area who have access to UNFPA supported SRHR/FP services and drugs” in 2018. Consequently, we are obliged to report the absolute number of clients who received SRHR/FP services from UNFPA supported service delivery points in the intervention areas”. This is an interim measure until it becomes possible to get reliable data on the size of the target group (mainly IDPs, humanitarian food assisted people and PSNP beneficiaries).
Indicator from the 2019 report:- Number of food distribution sites that integrated UNFPA supported FP/SRHR activities for IDPs, humanitarian food assisted people, and PSNP beneficiaries

title.narrative: Output 2:- SRHR/FP specific needs of vulnerable groups, including young people age 15-24 and women age 15-49 in IDP camps, humanitarian food distribution areas and PSNP areas (intervention areas) are addressed.

description.narrative:

Consequently, we are obliged to report the absolute number of clients who received SRHR/FP services from UNFPA supported service delivery points in the intervention areas”. This is an interim measure until it becomes possible to get reliable data on the size of the target group (mainly IDPs, humanitarian food assisted people and PSNP beneficiaries).
Indicator from the 2019 report:- Number of food distribution sites that integrated UNFPA supported FP/SRHR activities for IDPs, humanitarian food assisted people, and PSNP beneficiaries
